issues.description: In the template code, Stock.java and Main.java call a getter named getQuantity() on StockIngredient, but the StockIngredient class defines its quantity getter as retrieveQuantity(), not getQuantity(). This name mismatch prevents the code from compiling and conflicts with the solution’s use of getQuantity().
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the method retrieveQuantity() in StockIngredient.java to getQuantity(), or add a new getQuantity() method (returning the same int) so that Stock.java and Main.java calls to getQuantity() compile correctly.

issues.description: The template’s StockIngredient class provides a getter for quantity named retrieveQuantity(), whereas the solution and problem context (e.g., Main usage and standard getter convention) use getQuantity(). This naming mismatch for the same conceptual method will confuse students and cause compilation/test errors.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the template’s retrieveQuantity() method to getQuantity(), aligning with the problem expectation and solution implementation.
